The Basque Country experiences the repercussions of the Thirty Years' War and the Franco-Spanish War, resulting in armed conflicts, economic difficulties, and changes in political alliances.

headline: Basques were deprived of their trade with America and blocked by the Spanish high customs duties in the Ebro river
Ikurriña — Creation of the basque flag
text: Created by Sabino Arana Gori, considered the founder of modern Basque nationalism. First in Biscay, in 1933 for the whole Basque Country

headline: Spanish Civil War
text: The Basque country fouht on the Republican side under their own government and president.

headline: ETA (Euskadi ta Askatasuna which is Basque Homeland and Freedom) is formed to fight for Basque self-determination
text: On the 5th of September 2010 there was a truce between ETA and the Basque Country . On the 8th of April 2017 the ETA was disarmed and on the 2th of May 2018 ETA was ended

headline: Spreading of the Basque language
text: Basque and Castilian on equal footing, ETB (Basque Television) created in 1984

headline: Legalisation of the basque flag
text: Requested on the 16th by mayor cities and approved and raised in Pamplona for the first time

headline: Creation of the Basque government
text: Since 1981, and after the negotiations among the central Government, the Deputations and the Basque Government, the old foral structure of the Deputations began to be reimplemented.

headline: It represented Biscay and was adopted in 1936 as the flag of the Euskadi government before being adopted by the whole of Basque.

displayDate: The white cross of St Andrew is positioned on a green cross representing the oak of Guernica and a red background representing the Basque people.
